title: The Most Dangerous Game (1932 Thriller) Lose? Trophy room. Win? Nobody wins.

sources.title: The Most Dangerous Game (1932 Thriller) Lose? Trophy room. Win? Nobody wins.
sources.description:
The Finest Specimen I Ever Killed 
A yacht smashes into coral reefs—thanks to suspiciously misplaced channel lights—leaving hunter Robert Rainsford (Joel McCrea) stranded on an island owned by Count Zaroff (Leslie Banks), a Cossack aristocrat with a very niche hobby: human hunting.

Zaroff’s island isn’t a tropical getaway—it’s a twisted playground. His “guests” (shipwreck survivors) get a knife, a head start, and a 24-hour game of cat-and-mouse.  This world’s divided into two kinds of people—the hunter and the hunted.” Guess which one survives?

Alternative title: The Hounds of Zaroff (1932)

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/sJPP-RjEZgg


Directors: Irving Pichel, Ernest B. Schoedsack
Writers: James Ashmore Creelman, Richard Connell
Stars: Joel McCrea, Fay Wray, Leslie Banks, Robert Armstrong, Noble Johnson
Release date: September 16, 1932

@CultCinemaClassics
